content:
• Monday, October 24, 2011
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) pops in the post-trading session after its Q3 earnings easily beat Street...

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) pops in the post-trading session after its Q3 earnings easily beat Street estimates. Revenues soared on a 25% upswing in billings and solid demand for its unified threat management (UTM) solutions platform. Deferred revenue also jumped to $275.1M as of September 30, a Y/Y increase of over 17%. Shares +9.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM
  • UIS

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS) is this afternoon's anti-Netflix, gaining 18.9% AH after reporting Q3 revenue...

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS) is this afternoon's anti-Netflix, gaining 18.9% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $1.02B (+6% Y/Y) and EPS of $1.63, crushing consensus by $75M and $0.93. Gross margin increased 320 bps Y/Y to 27.9%. Strong ClearPath mainframe sales and growth in Unisys' non-U.S. federal IT outsourcing business offset U.S. federal weakness.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM
  • WBMD

    After a big move today on word Carl Icahn took a 7.94% stake, WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) scoots even...

    After a big move today on word Carl Icahn took a 7.94% stake, WebMD (NASDAQ:WBMD) scoots even higher after George Soros discloses a 5.6% stake in the firm. Shares +11.5% in regular trade, +1.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • STM

    More on STMicroelectronics' (NYSE:STM) Q3: 4.9% Q/Q revenue decline driven by 10% drop in...

    More on STMicroelectronics' (NYSE:STM) Q3: 4.9% Q/Q revenue decline driven by 10% drop in Automotive sales, 8% drop in "Industrial & Other" sales. Gross margin declined 230 bps Q/Q to 35.8%. Company expects Q4 revenue of $2.15B-$2.3B, below a $2.5B consensus. Gross margin expected to drop to 32-35%. STM -5.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • IVZ

    Shares of Invesco (IVZ +5%) finished near the highs of the day after the company reported Q3...

    Shares of Invesco (IVZ +5%) finished near the highs of the day after the company reported Q3 earnings earlier that beat estimates. Profit rose 7.9% as higher investment management and performance fees boosted revenue, despite a decline in assets under management due to market volatility.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM
  • FSLR

    As First Solar (FSLR +7.8%) was winding up its sharp rally, JPMorgan cut its stock price target...

    As First Solar (FSLR +7.8%) was winding up its sharp rally, JPMorgan cut its stock price target to $50 due to "significant erosion in investor confidence on the longer term growth story for the solar PV sector and the company... Stock multiple compression for FSLR is evidence of the increasing level of pessimism the Street has towards the sector outlook."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • TXN

    More on Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN): Q3 was better than estimates, but below the sesonal...

    More on Texas Instruments (NYSE:TXN): Q3 was better than estimates, but below the sesonal average. The company expects the same in Q4 as economic uncertainty continues to weigh on demand in almost every major market segment. It now sees its EPS between $0.28 - $0.36 per share on revenue in the range of $3.26B - $3.54B, below the Street consensus for $0.54 per share on $3.43B in revenue. Shares -1.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): "We used $39.6M in Q3 to repurchase 182K shares at an average cost basis...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): "We used $39.6M in Q3 to repurchase 182K shares at an average cost basis of $218." The stock closed at $118.84 today ($93.86 in AH trade).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM | 15 Comments
  • HXL

    More on Hexcel (NYSE:HXL): Q3 easily beats estimates, led by a 31% jump in sales in its...

    More on Hexcel (NYSE:HXL): Q3 easily beats estimates, led by a 31% jump in sales in its commercial aerospace unit. The company sees the trend continuing into Q4 and raises FY11 EPS guidance, now expecting its EPS to be around $1.18 - $1.23 on sales of $1.3B - $1.4B. Shares +5.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • NFLX

    Also in Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q3 report: Only 7% of new subscribers opt for both streaming and...

    Also in Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q3 report: Only 7% of new subscribers opt for both streaming and DVD plans. Nonetheless, CEO Reed Hastings says "if we were going to lower prices, we would do it on streaming." Netflix expects a Q4 "contributing margin" of just 8% for its domestic streaming business, due to higher content spending. NFLX -20.9% AH. (.pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    More on Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q3: Total U.S. subscribers declined by 810K, international subs...

    More on Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) Q3: Total U.S. subscribers declined by 810K, international subs grew by 510K. 20M-21.5M U.S. streaming subs expected in Q4, compared with 21.45M in Q3. U.S. DVD subs expected to fall to 10.3M-11.3M from Q3's 13.9M. International subs expected to grow to 1.6M-2M from Q3's 1.48M. NFLX -18.5% AH. (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 15 Comments
  • VECO

    More on Veeco Instruments (NASDAQ:VECO): Q3 beats estimates but lowers its guidance for Q4, now...

    More on Veeco Instruments (NASDAQ:VECO): Q3 beats estimates but lowers its guidance for Q4, now seeing its EPS around $0.54 - $0.86 per share on revenue between $175M - $215M. The Street consensus was for $1.03 per share on $237M in revenue. Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • HXL

    Hexcel (NYSE:HXL): Q3 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $351.8M (+19.5% Y/Y). Shares +4.9%...

    Hexcel (NYSE:HXL): Q3 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $351.8M (+19.5% Y/Y). Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q3 EPS of $1.16 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $822M (+ 49% Y/Y) beats by...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX): Q3 EPS of $1.16 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $822M (+ 49% Y/Y) beats by $10.2M. Company forecasts Q4 EPS of $0.36-$0.70, below a $1.09 consensus. NFLX -14.6% AH. (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 5 Comments

  • Already having a big day, commodities and currencies get an extra boost from NY Fed chief...

    Already having a big day, commodities and currencies get an extra boost from NY Fed chief Dudley. "It's possible that we could do another round of QE, we could do QE round 3," he says in response to a question after a speech. Oil is a big winner, WTI +4.5% to $91.31, and in backwardation for the 1st time since QE2 was boss.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • BTU

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANG +9.2%) is the top gainer on the S&P 500, surging as a rise in...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANG +9.2%) is the top gainer on the S&P 500, surging as a rise in the overall equities market and improved manufacturing data from China give the energy sector a lift. Coal producers have been hit lately by jitters about demand from Asia. BTU +4.8%, ACI +5.8%, PCX +8.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • AVNW

    Aviat Networks (AVNW -8%) takes a hit after it's downgraded to Hold from Buy at Brigantine,...

    Aviat Networks (AVNW -8%) takes a hit after it's downgraded to Hold from Buy at Brigantine, citing management concerns and a lack of near-term catalysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • PAA

    Plains All American (PAA +1.8%) defends its takeover bid of rival SemGroup (NYSE:SEMG) saying a...

    Plains All American (PAA +1.8%) defends its takeover bid of rival SemGroup (NYSE:SEMG) saying a merger will deliver greater value to shareholders than any of the company's other alternatives and create "significant value for synergies". Shares of SemGroup are up 17.4%. Updated 3:41 p.m.: SemGroup confirms it is rejecting Plains' offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • XL

    Shares of insurance brokers post strong gains as Barclays raises its view on the...

    Shares of insurance brokers post strong gains as Barclays raises its view on the property-and-casualty insurance space to Overweight: "The insurance brokers are the best early cycle P&C stocks because most of the benefits of improved prices should improve earnings and margins." Barclays upgrades XL +4.7%, WSH +3%, AJG +2.2%, BRO +2.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • LOW

    Lowe's (LOW -1.3%) is trading down after Citi initiates the stock with a lukewarm Neutral...

    Lowe's (LOW -1.3%) is trading down after Citi initiates the stock with a lukewarm Neutral rating. Citi says that despite a relatively decent valuation, it sees limited upside from current price levels and recommends staying on the sidelines.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • DHX

    Companies offering online career services are rallying with gusto, led out by Dice Holdings (DHX...

    Companies offering online career services are rallying with gusto, led out by Dice Holdings (DHX +10.1%). With no employment reports out today, the surge could be tied to glimmers of hope that a double-dip recession can be dodged - pushing the underemployed back online for a career retooling. Advancers: LNKD +6.9%, MWW +4.2%, MAN 5.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • RNOW

    RightNow (RNOW +19.3%) is trading just $0.10 below Oracle's (ORCL +1.7%) $43/share buyout price,...

    RightNow (RNOW +19.3%) is trading just $0.10 below Oracle's (ORCL +1.7%) $43/share buyout price, a level suggesting investors might be betting on a higher bid arriving. Analysts are generally positive on the deal, with Beagle Research arguing "it brings a lot of current thinking about customers and designing the customer experience into Oracle."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +3.2%) continues its strong October performance after Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) name...

    Yahoo (YHOO +3.2%) continues its strong October performance after Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) name gets thrown into the company's soap opera-esque buyout saga. Scott Cleland thinks Google is "playing with antitrust fire" by dancing with Yahoo. But perhaps Google's goal is to simply keep its rival out of Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) hands by financing a competing bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • DRE

    Duke Realty (DRE +5.8%) trades higher today after Stifel Nicolaus ups the shares to Buy. Stifel...

    Duke Realty (DRE +5.8%) trades higher today after Stifel Nicolaus ups the shares to Buy. Stifel says the recently announced $1.08B sale of its suburban office buildings to Blackstone is a transformative event for the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • FXI

    Magazine cover indicator alert: The China bubble possibly blowing up makes this week's cover of...

    Magazine cover indicator alert: The China bubble possibly blowing up makes this week's cover of Time. The magazine might be a bit late to the party; one popular China ETF, FXI is up about 25% in 3 weeks, including a 5.5% pop today. It's still down 18% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • IFF

    International Flavors & Fragrances (IFF -1.9%) loses steam after getting slapped with a...

    International Flavors & Fragrances (IFF -1.9%) loses steam after getting slapped with a downgrade from RBC Capital to Sector Perform from Outperform along with a clipped price target, $63 from $65. The company's stock price hit an all-time high last May.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • CUR

    Shares of Neuralstem (NYSEMKT:CUR), up 11%, stage a rally after the firm announces it received...

    Shares of Neuralstem (NYSEMKT:CUR), up 11%, stage a rally after the firm announces it received FDA approval to advance to transplating patients in the upper back region with spinal cord stem cells to treat ALS after previously only injecting in the lower back region.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • CAT

    There's no denying Caterpillar's (CAT +5.8%) strong quarter, but Zero Hedge thinks some...

    There's no denying Caterpillar's (CAT +5.8%) strong quarter, but Zero Hedge thinks some perspective is in order: "Q3 2011 earnings expectations have dropped over 10% in the last three months to their lowest level since Jan. 2011 - and Q4 expectations remain at Jan. 2011 lows and are also down almost 6.5% in the last three months."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM | 7 Comments
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +5.7%) knocks out a gain, as it joins a host of specialty retailers...

    Urban Outfitters (URBN +5.7%) knocks out a gain, as it joins a host of specialty retailers recovering from recent beatdowns. A rosy report from FedEx (FDX +3.1%) on their anticipated holiday season deliveries may be steering investors (previous). Gainers: ZUMZ +6.4%, AEO +4.5%, BKE +4.7%, ANF +4.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • CBS

    CBS (CBS +3.4%) will grow EPS from 2010-15 by 25% annually, Morgan Stanley says, retaining...

    CBS (CBS +3.4%) will grow EPS from 2010-15 by 25% annually, MorganStanley says, retaining it as a top pick among entertainment stocks, although shares do not reflect an anticipated recession in 2012. A decline in ad growth should be offset by revenues CBS will rake in from online video providers such as Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) and Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • BHP

    BHP Billiton (BHP +5.6%) gets a boost from an upgrade by Goldman to Conviction Buy, citing the...

    BHP Billiton (BHP +5.6%) gets a boost from an upgrade by Goldman to Conviction Buy, citing the companys oil exposure and solid growth outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • MRVL

    Cavium (CAVM +4.7%) outperforms thanks to a note from Rodman & Renshaw's Ashok Kumar, who...

    Cavium (CAVM +4.7%) outperforms thanks to a note from Rodman & Renshaw's Ashok Kumar, who suggests the company, whose chips often go into 3G/4G base stations, is a worthy buyout target for Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM). Rival network processor vendor NetLogic (NASDAQ:NETL) was acquired by Broadcom (BRCM) last month.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +6.3%) is rebounding a bit from last week's Einhorn-induced...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +6.3%) is rebounding a bit from last week's Einhorn-induced drubbing. The rally comes in spite of privately-owned Rogers Family launching a line of single-serve coffee cups that can leverage Green Mountain's Keurig brewers, while avoiding royalty payments to the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • FDX

    Shares of retail stores (XRT +3%) enjoy a boost from FedEx's (FDX +2.8%) forecast of record...

    Shares of retail stores (XRT +3%) enjoy a boost from FedEx's (FDX +2.8%) forecast of record holiday shipments. FedEx expects to ship 17M packages, a 10% rise Y/Y, and overall retail sales to rise 2.5%-3% this holiday season. Leading today's charge is JC Penney (JCP +3.7%), named a top pick last week at T2 Partners; also ANN +3.3%, M +4.7%, OMX +9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • CMPR

    VistaPrint Limited (VPRT +6%) gains after announcing it's acquired Albumprinter, a privately...

    VistaPrint Limited (VPRT +6%) gains after announcing it's acquired Albumprinter, a privately held Dutch photo book and photo product company, for $83M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • PETS

    PetMed Express (PETS +8.4%) jumps after its FQ2 beat estimates, despite a 21% Y/Y dip in...

    PetMed Express (PETS +8.4%) jumps after its FQ2 beat estimates, despite a 21% Y/Y dip in earnings due to a change in its product mix. Overall, investors appear to be encouraged by the company's effort to spur growth by expanding into pet supplies. Rising costs continue to pressure margins, but are being largely offset by a more aggressive pricing strategy.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +3.8%) purchases the remaining 10% stake it doesn't already own in Molycorp Silmet...

    Molycorp (MCP +3.8%) purchases the remaining 10% stake it doesn't already own in Molycorp Silmet AS, giving it full ownership of the European rare-earth processing company.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • SWM

    Tobacco industry supplier Schweitzer-Mauduit (SWM +16.5%) pops after resolving an intellectual...

    Tobacco industry supplier Schweitzer-Mauduit (SWM +16.5%) pops after resolving an intellectual property dispute with specialty paper company Delfortgroup over fire-safe cigarette paper, and agreeing to a licensing agreement with the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +4.9%) gains after announcing the FDA will review the company's application...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +4.9%) gains after announcing the FDA will review the company's application for its Peginesatide drug, which treats anemia in patients with chronic kidney disease, on December 7, and has established an "action date" for the application of March 27.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • FCX

    In addition to today's rally in copper, Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold (FCX +7%) gets an...

    In addition to today's rally in copper, Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold (FCX +7%) gets an added boost from being touted in Barron's over the weekend. The article notes the stock is trading for far less than the value of its mining assets, and the company could be a major beneficiary of a rebound in metal prices, or possibly even a takeover offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • LPSN

    LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) and eGain (NASDAQ:EGAN) show the strongest upward push of a group of...

    LivePerson (NASDAQ:LPSN) and eGain (NASDAQ:EGAN) show the strongest upward push of a group of cloud software companies drawing some interest after Oracle (ORCL +2.2%) gobbled up RightNow Technologies (RNOW +19.3%). LPSN +8.5%. EGAN +8.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • ARW

    Chip and IT hardware distributor Arrow Electronics (ARW +4.3%) shoots higher after its board...

    Chip and IT hardware distributor Arrow Electronics (ARW +4.3%) shoots higher after its board authorizes a new $150M share repurchase program. Arrow adds it has already completed a $100M repurchase program authorized in July.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.5%) is joining today's rally in spite of a downgrade to reduce from...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +4.5%) is joining today's rally in spite of a downgrade to reduce from GMP Securities, which is also lowering its PT to $18. GMP was underwhelmed by co-CEO Mike Laziridis' remarks at last week's developer conference, and doubts "RIM can restore the confidence of customers and investors."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • LO

    Lorillard (LO -2.9%) trades down after its Q3 earnings missed on a per share basis, despite...

    Lorillard (LO -2.9%) trades down after its Q3 earnings missed on a per share basis, despite attempts to prop up weak margins with a share buyback. Overall revenue was weak, with net income down 2.5% Y/Y, as the cigarette maker struggles with difficult wholesale inventory patterns and declining smoking rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • KMB

    Kimberly-Clark (KMB -5.1%) gets hit after it reports an inline Q3, but cuts its FY11 sales...

    Kimberly-Clark (KMB -5.1%) gets hit after it reports an inline Q3, but cuts its FY11 sales outlook. The company now expects to earn between $4.80 - $4.90 per share on sales growth of 4% - 6%, as the maker of Kleenex and Huggies diapers continues to be hampered by higher costs and weakening demand in its developed markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (TXN +3.5%) gains ahead of today's Q3 report, as Wedbush lifts its PT to $36....

    Texas Instruments (TXN +3.5%) gains ahead of today's Q3 report, as Wedbush lifts its PT to $36. The firm thinks TI's Q3, which was guided lower in September, will be in-line with estimates, but expects Q4 guidance to be above. UBS is more pessimistic, expecting soft Q4 guidance as the chip industry finishes its inventory correction.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • FCX

    Comex Dec. copper +5.6%, perhaps headed for its largest two-day rally since March 2009, on...

    Comex Dec. copper +5.6%, perhaps headed for its largest two-day rally since March 2009, on optimism over a European debt deal and the first expansion in China PMI since June. The China data raises hopes that "Asian demand might compensate for reduced demand from slowing economic activity in the U.S. and euro zone," Standard Bank writes. FCX +6.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • AEGN

    Insituform Technologies (INSU) tacks on a 3.3% gain after announcing one of its joint ventures...

    Insituform Technologies (INSU) tacks on a 3.3% gain after announcing one of its joint ventures landed a $67.3M contract to install pipeline in Morocco. The company expects to see $120M of revenue in FY12 from business in the Middle East and Africa.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • YGE

    Solar stocks are rallying (KWT +5.6%) thanks to positive comments from Yingli (YGE +3.4%) about...

    Solar stocks are rallying (KWT +5.6%) thanks to positive comments from Yingli (YGE +3.4%) about German and Italian demand, as well as a general embrace of the risk trade. Some of the biggest winners: FSLR +8.3%. STP +8.7%. CSIQ +8.2%. LDK +7.3%. SPWRA +7.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • AER

    AerCap (AER +2.2%) signs a $400M credit facility to provide long-term financing for the purchase...

    AerCap (AER +2.2%) signs a $400M credit facility to provide long-term financing for the purchase of 12 Boeing (BA -0.3%) 737-800 aircraft. The company says it will lease the planes to American Airlines (AMR -2.4%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • WEN

    Wendy's (WEN -1.5%) drifts lower on a Suntrust downgrade to Neutral. The firm says the fast food...

    Wendy's (WEN -1.5%) drifts lower on a Suntrust downgrade to Neutral. The firm says the fast food chain faces a challenging consumer environment with heavy competition, and it's concerned about the viability of the company's turnaround plan.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM

  • European shares (and all risk assets correlated to them) fly higher on an AP report of a German...

    European shares (and all risk assets correlated to them) fly higher on an AP report of a German official saying the expanded EU rescue fund will top €1.4T. Stoxx 50 +1.3%, with all of that gain coming in the past few minutes.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • XLNX

    Xilinx (XLNX +4.8%) shares surge after Pacific Crest raises its rating on the stock to...

    Xilinx (XLNX +4.8%) shares surge after Pacific Crest raises its rating on the stock to Outperform from Sector Perform, with a $40 price target. History suggests the upcoming quarter should be at or near the bottom for the programmable logic device market, and “estimates could prove conservative exiting a downturn.” the analysis says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • FNFG

    First Niagara (FNFG -3%) trades lower after Raymond James cuts the shares to to Market Perform,...

    First Niagara (FNFG -3%) trades lower after Raymond James cuts the shares to to Market Perform, citing the company's acquisition of 195 HSBC (HBC +1.9%) branches and the need to raise capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • TEX

    The rally in shares of global equipment manufacturers broadens (previous) as analysts start to...

    The rally in shares of global equipment manufacturers broadens (previous) as analysts start to weigh in on Caterpillar's Q3 report. Goldman Sachs analyst Jerry Revich helps push up the sector by saying his firm sees "compelling supply tailwinds" in CAT's mining business. Gainers: TEX +6.5%, MTW, +6.2% TEX +6.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • ACOM

    Ancestry.com (ACOM +3.7%) rises on its inclusion in Barrons' list of tech stock picks, and also...

    Ancestry.com (ACOM +3.7%) rises on its inclusion in Barrons' list of tech stock picks, and also on a bullish note from Jefferies: the firm expects Ancestry.com to report in-line Q3 results on Wednesday, in spite of investor concerns about subscription growth. Other Barrons picks moving higher: ERTS +2.8%. NUAN +2.4%. FTNT +2%. TIBX +3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • WCG

    WellCare Group (NYSE:WCG) racks up a 6.8% gain as small and mid-sized companies in the managed...

    WellCare Group (NYSE:WCG) racks up a 6.8% gain as small and mid-sized companies in the managed care part of the healthcare industry continue to get a lift from a Barron's article over the weekend pointing to increased M&A activity in the sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tanker (NAT +2.6%) gains after Cantor Fitzgerald upgrades shares to Hold. While...

    Nordic American Tanker (NAT +2.6%) gains after Cantor Fitzgerald upgrades shares to Hold. While expecting Nordic's exposure to weak spot shipping prices to limit near-term profitability, Cantor likes the company's current valuation, low leverage, and reliance on Suezmax-class tankers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • UMC

    Shares of United Microelectronics (UMC +4.8%) jump on rumors it has broken into the supply chain...

    Shares of United Microelectronics (UMC +4.8%) jump on rumors it has broken into the supply chain for Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Kindle Fire tablet computer. DigiTimes reports that the tablet is being manufactured using process technology at the world's second largest contract chip maker.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO +12.1%) surges in early trading after Barron's names the company its top tech...

    Fusion-io (FIO +12.1%) surges in early trading after Barron's names the company its top tech stock pick for 2012 on account of expected buyout interest, while setting a price target of $52. Rival enterprise flash memory module vendor STEC is posting a 2.4% gain.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • AET

    Shares of Coventry Health Care (CVH) move 7% higher after reports emerge penciling in the...

    Shares of Coventry Health Care (CVH) move 7% higher after reports emerge penciling in the company as a potential takover target. Barron's says the stock prices of smaller companies such as Coventry in the managed care industry could jump 50% as bigger players eye consolidation. Potential Targets: HNT, AGP, CNC, MOH.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
